definition: lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
variant of 唇[chun2]
lip
tooth/CL:顆|颗[ke1]
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of

sentences.english: Any man's death diminishes me because I am involved in mankind.
sentences.chinese: 任何人的死都令我萎缩，因为我和全人类唇齿相依。

sentences.english: In such an interdependent world, what happens in Europe and the US will have an impact in Asia, probably sooner rather than later.
sentences.chinese: 在这唇齿相依的世界，欧美的现状早晚会影响亚洲。

sentences.english: The relationship between language and culture is intertwined.
The interests of Hong Kong and the Motherland are intricately linked and intertwined.
sentences.chinese: 香港与祖国一脉相连，唇齿相依。

sentences.english: The supportive relationship between lips and teeth; (fig) to be in a close, interdependent relationship.
sentences.chinese: 唇齿相依是对我们关系的最好形容。

sentences.english: Creativity and well being are intricately interrelated.
sentences.chinese: 创造力和福祉是唇齿相依的。

definition: (of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
lit. without the lips, the teeth feel the cold (idiom); fig. intimately interdependent
(separated only by) a narrow strip of water
to share the same interests (idiom)/to be closely related/to be in the same boat
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
to stick together through thick and thin (idiom)
to be interdependent
to make no distinction between what's one's own and what's another's (idiom)/to share everything/to be on very intimate terms
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
as close as brothers (idiom); deep friendship
cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
family-like close relationship (idiom)
closely interrelated/intimately related
to look at one another/to face each other
non-aggression
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
